review: As a college student, I used to love heading home on weekends and going to California Pizza Kitchen with friends. Now post-college, those days are rare and very much missed. In fact, given all the options now, it is saying something that I even remember this restaurant. More so, more shocking still is that I still love it. I find that to be flabbergasting as the majority of restaurants I loved five or six years ago, I absolutely hate today. That said, we ended up at this location when we went to Sawgrass Mills. The weekend before we had gone to another mall and regretted not going to California Pizza Kitchen, so this was our first stop when shopping. Going to the restaurant reminded me greatly at how wonderful the food tastes. When we entered, my boyfriend and I had no wait whatsoever. As we sat, I admired the airy and open feel of this location. It was my first time there and I must say I may admittedly prefer it to the one I used to frequent down in Coral Gables. At any rate, I am pleased to say that this chain is consistent. Good service, great food, the works, regardless of location. That's a win-win in my book. Ordered water and strawberry lemonade as our drinks. I had the lemonade admittedly and it was a bit sweet but nevertheless refreshing. We munched on freshly made bread and oil, while we waited for our pizzas. Boyfriend ordered a pepperoni one, while I had the signature BBQ chicken pizza. Pizza was personal size, but I found it huge. I took half of it home as leftovers. My boyfriend, in comparison, inhaled all of his. Debated dessert but skipped it. Paid and we were on our merry way. All this was less than $40, which is a great deal. It could've been better though. I had a coupon for being a rewards member and it said $10 off $40, but we just didn't reach it. Oh well; maybe next time, and even if it goes to waste, goodness knows that they send out plenty of rewards.

After last Friday's dining experience, I have to update and downgrade my review for CPK. What was once a decent chain, is now YUCK! We came on a recent Friday, were seated right away, and had the worst service.  Once we were finally able to order waters and a round of beers, we waited for our beverages. It was passed 20 minutes and we literally had nothing. We then ordered our food- a petite wedge to start, and a pizza each. We received our salad, but still no beer! Whyyy?  We finished the salad, asked twice more about the beers, and finally received them at the same time as the pizza. Honestly, waiting in excess of 15 minutes is crazy for one round of draft beers for two people. On top of that, the food was not so great. My California Club pizza had over-cooked chicken all over it. We asked for refills on waters, over and over, and finally got one refilled after we received the check.  Never coming back again! So long, CPK!

As a CPK Preferred customer once in a while you get some good deals in your account. One of the 10 off 40 was siting in my account for almost a month and was about to expire so we took this opportunity to eat some tasty CPK pizzas. Usually I hate to eat at sawgrass as the service is below par but on this trip the weather was amazing and we were able to sit outside and I can say the service was very good. We were sat immediately and got a great outside table. Our server promptly took our order and we were munching within 15 minutes. We ordered the California veggie and a unique tortilla pizza called the tostada.  I also ordered the mango lemonade and if you have read my previous restaurant reviews I usually get a lemonade. Now the lemonade wasn't as good as the ones you find in Budapest but they did ok. The pizzas were yummy and we had left overs which we enjoyed the next day. We also ordered the brownie with ice cream along with great service we finally were able to redeem sawgrass as a place worthy to eat while you are there shopping.

I've been here 3-4 times since moving to FL last summer.   I was a big fan of CPK when I lived in California since it was next to impossible to find good pizza on the west coast.  Also, while in pet friendly CA, we learned that this chain would typically allow pets on the patio and since we were often traveling with our small dogs that worked well for us as a sit down meal option.  I don't believe this location allows pets on the patio, but the one in Boca Raton does.    I now live in South Florida (with other ex-New Yorkers) and I'm fortunate enough to have found some non-chain pizza joints.  I prefer an authentic mom and pop made NY style pie, but CPK is more of a gourmet type of pizza.  If I'm coming here, I love doing so at lunch time (Monday-Friday).  There is a great lunch special and menu, I would say you will get the most bang for your buck that way. I recommend the lunch size pizza with a side salad, it's the perfect portion size.  We stopped in here tonight since we had a gift card left over from Christmas.  We were seated by a friendly woman.  Our waiter quickly appeared, we put in our drink and food order.  We weren't asked if we wanted bread, which is ok since we neither of us was super hungry.  I always wonder how they decide whether to ask you if you want it, but keep this in mind incase you are ravenously hungry. Our food was fresh and tasty.  Took a little while to get refills on our waters, but not the end of the world.  The waiter did ask me for my CPK rewards card info, so I was happy he remembered that.  We didn't order desert tonight, but I recommend the butter cake with a scoop of ice cream.  It's the perfect size to split, it's a good size. Prices have gone up a bit at CPK, so I think that's why the weekday lunch special is the best deal here.  This restaurant offers inside and outside seating.  Nothing beats outside seating on a warm Florida February night!

Baked Potato Soup & Chicken Club Sandwhich  very nasty , i had to take the sandwhich apart because the bread was very old and hard. Never coming back here or bringing my family. Waitress only came to bring food, not even refill my drink

Stopped in on a Saturday night after an early movie.  The place was crowded but we were seated in less than 10 minutes.  I ordered the Thai Chicken salad and my friend ordered the lettuce wraps.  The server soon brought some fresh bread.  After the order was placed and the bread had arrived, I asked our server, Edward, if he would order me a Moscow Mule and he did.  About 5 minutes later, maybe 10-15 since we were seated, our food was delivered and Edward immediately apologized that the food came before my drink.  I told him don't be silly.  The timing was perfectly acceptable.  My salad was very good and my friend said her lettuce wraps were great.  Note to self to try them next time.  My drink was good, but pricey. As much as I detest the Sawgrass Mall, I would certainly return to CPK and ask for Edward.

We had Pauly as our sever and she was great! Friendly and efficient. Our drinks and appetizers (guacamole, and buffalo cauliflower) were delicious.  This is our first time here and it won't be our last. I highly recommend the orchid sangria.

Great ambience and food is more than above average. I don't have hope for restaurant chains but this spot surprised me with tasty food and good music playing in the background.  Sangria flight was fun and all 3 were different abs tasty. The pizza is delicious, nice thin crust and lightly flaky. Sign up for the rewards and get points for each time you dine at all CPK's

Reason I gave 3 stars: I noticed a waitress who was handling food without gloves. She did not wash her hands before cutting and placing bread on a plate. Other than that..Food was great! Service was great as well! The server always had a smile on his face and was very attentive.

I sat at the bar for this visit. The restaurant was clean and airy which I like in a restaurant. The bartender Brett was friendly and attentive to me.  I ordered the Manhattan, which every bartender worth his salt should know, and the Sicilian thin crust pizza. Brett promptly made the drink and it tasted how it should taste.  The pizza came about 15 minutes later which was a little faster than I thought but was nice surprise.  The Sicilian was delightful spicy but not overwhelming.  The crust had good crunch to it and cooked to perfection.  If you come here go to the bar and ask for Brett and he is not there Cindy is great as well.

Made another visit and we were given a table and seats that were dirty. We stood and waited while the busboy cleaned the table and wiped down the seats. Mind you, they already placed the new silverware down before we got the table. So either someone isn't doing their job or their not being very stringent with their cleanliness protocols. Ewwww! We were sat near the kitchen, so things were kind of loud. Our waiter was just okay. Timing wasn't his forte. The food was okay. My son had the Margherita Pizza and I had the chicken dumplings and the chicken lettuce wraps. They were fine. Overall, the visit was not up to par from the beginning. The hostesses should always check the tables to make sure everything is fine before seating anyone. So, that set the mood for a not so wonderful meal. The floors throughout the restaurant had straw papers and stuff strewn about. Will leave my rating to three stars because I know this place can do better than this. Come on guys!!!!!
Great place the staff and managers are very attentive, we enjoy it here and healthier then the place across

I went recently and must say I was impressed. I went because it was a fundraiser for my school. I hate pizza!  My kids had the BBQ chicken pizza and it was great. My husband had a personal pizza and it was great but a bit pricy for the size of it.  I had the chicken piccata, which was recommended by the server. It was a flavorful dish and I would get it again. Kids had sundaes that were only .99!  Service was great. Restaurant was clean and beautiful but no ambiance. It was also very slow all night.  I'd go there again for sure, but with all the choices near this location I'm not racing there tomorrow. Super sweet they they give back to the community. 3.5 stars
It's a pizza place but my least favorite thing they have is their pizza. Great food at decent price. Love this place.

We ordered three dishes, pizza and two pastas. Nothing good the food, and to top it off, we spent the scare of our life. We ordered the pasta dish similar to the Thau and placed a few small red chili peppers that we thought were dried tomatoes , I bit the tip of one of the chiles and I was dying , I got the tension, I started to Shake and my tongue felt like i was swelling, I thought I was going to die. The manager of the restaurant brought me milk. I almost die in that Restaurant. Never go to this place, even if you leave Sawgrass Mills Mall starving. Of course! No pictures for this

TIP: join the rewards programs...good perks! You get a free small plate when you sign up but also in the month of October, they are offering $10 off of $40 spent. PRO-ample amount of seating, friendly staff, good menu We've visited twice in the past two weeks and both times left us wanting more. This particular CPK has a nice ambiance and a great staff. All the staff are welcoming, warm, friendly, and are very familiar with the menu. Both times we visited our waiter was fantastic. The first time we sat inside and the second time we sat outside on 10/17/15 around 5pm. When we sat outside, it was brought to our attention there was only one waitress for all the tables but it was not noticeable. She was on top of all the tables and serving all of them with a smile and excitement. We ordered the spinach mushroom flatbread for the 2nd time because we loved it so much the first time. We also ordered the shrimp scampi pizza after our waitress mentioned that it is her favorite pizza. Both pizzas once again did not disappoint. My favorite part is when they grate fresh parmesan on your pizzas. YUM! We also ordered Funky Buddha Floridian beer, Abita Purple Haze, and the Agave margarita. They have an extensive drink menu with many craft beer offerings. The agave margarita was limey and strong. I was pleasantly surprised. For dessert, we ordered the Salted Caramel Pudding and the red velvet cake. The red velvet cake was mediocre but the ice cream served with it was perfect. More importantly, the Salted Caramel Pudding was SOMETHING ELSE! The pudding came in a mason jar. The bottom layer contained chocolate cookie-like crumbles. The second layer was the pudding then came a mound of whipped cream drizzled with caramel. I put my spoon in the jar and immediately soared to dessert heaven!

I have never been more disappointed in an experience like I was today. It was more like how fast can you order everything you will need your entire sitting with your server because she isn't going to ever come back. Other than the fact she is going to only ask if you want the bill next time you see her. I wanted more drinks since they were empty the entire time. I wanted to order more food never had a chance to, overall terrible lunch!! Then when I told her I wanted to order a bunch of more food and drinks she just says I was at the party on the other side?? I don't understand. Never again.
Took forever to get food, they asked for my pin at checkout which they shouldn't ask for, and the service was bad.

I love this restaurant but don't eat here often because anything that tastes this good is FATTENING. I have to have Thai Chicken pizza every time I do go. I never go out on the exotic side. I'm a meat and potatoes girl but someone introduced me to this pizza and I'm salivating for it now.  Their Cobb salad is always a treat and spaghetti  Bolognese I adore.

Very good pizzas, flat breads and salads. There is a lunch menu that offers nice combos of a small pizza or half sandwich with a small salad for 10-11 dollars.  Service is good but not stellar.  It's good for a quick lunch or a pizza night with friends.

We came specifically for the Butter Cake. It was my daughter's birthday and that's all she wanted. Between the 4 of us we ordered 2 cappuccinos, a butter cake and a strawberry shortcake. The cappuccino were excellent. The butter cake was SUPER RICH, way too rich for my taste but others in my group seemed to love it. The strawberry shortcake was by far my favorite. The cake has a nice flavor and the strawberries were naturally sweet with not a lot of sugar. I would definitely come back again for dessert...and dinner!

Pizza was cold when it came out. I ordered a Hawaiian pizza with pepperoni but there is a piece of ham under my pizza. I ordered spinach dip as an appetizer and the plate is dirty. Do they not check this stuff in the kitchen the bartender is nice but I seriously question their sanitary procedures.

Our first time here and we really enjoyed it here! The decor and vibe are really nice! Great and friendly service! Food is really good! The manager Eddie even introduced himself to us being our first visit and gave us a ticket for a free small plate. I think we will be coming again when we are at Sawgrass.
Love sitting at the bar for drinks apps and pizza. Recommend the strawberry basil martini or blueberry smash with candied ginger.

I woke up tired the day after Black Friday knowing all I wanted to do was sleep in, stay home and have a lazy day. But that turned into my girlfriend convincing me to go shopping. I knew at that point the crowds were going to be everywhere and I decided that I would need good pizza to kick off the day. Since we were headed to Sawgrass Mills Mall, I decided to skip on all the other pizza places we have in the area and go for California Pizza Kitchen. I have not been to a CPK in probably five years so I was excited to finally go there. I guess I never realized that they also had a full service bar. Their cocktail menu looked pretty appetizing and I had a hard time choosing what I wanted. I decided to go with the Citrus Adobo Margarita. Being a Margarita lover, this was definitely a Hit and I would go back to CPK just for that drink alone. It was sweet and tart, spicey and sour on the finish. The Pizza menu looked good. Some of the classics were still around like the Original BBQ Chicken Pizza and Thai Chicken Pizza. For some reason, I was craving their BLT pizza but was sad to see it was not on the menu any more. I should of asked but did not get a chance to, I got distracted reading other things on the Menu. I settled for the California Club which sounded like a ramped up version of the BLT with chicken on it. It featured Nueske's applewood smoked bacon, roasted chicken, mozzarella, arugula, basil and avocado. This is a new establishment in the Sawgrass Mills Mall Oasis strip so the place was clean and nicely decorated. They had plenty of seating available at 1PM on Saturday but seamed like they had enough space for the busy hours. They offer Patio seating, curbside pickup and online ordering. I will be for sure coming back in the near future and trying different pizzas.

This place is great! Friendly, fast and attentive service, great food, drinks and desert. Management is always around, checking on your level of satisfaction and quick to fix any issues that may come up. And for what you get, prices are very reasonable. In my opinion, out of all CPKs around, this is the best location. It's fairly new, just a few years old so design is modern and Cali casual, very comfortable and relaxing. It has both indoor and outdoor seating that can accomodate small or large parties. Some of my faves are: Jamaican Jerk Chicken Pizza California Club Pizza Quinoa and Arugula Salad  Chile Relleno My hubby loves: Tequila Lime Fettuccine Barbecue Chicken Salad Jambalaya Oh yeah, nd deserts: You have to try Butter Cake and Strawberry Short cake, AMAZING!!! Check it out, you will be happy you did :-)
We ordered the cedar salmon. It came quickly, but sadly it was a little bland and the corn was slightly burnt (so it had that flavour). We did order a mushroom & spinach Flatbread with was excellent.

Place looks great and food was good as well. Plates and dishes were fairly small when considering the price but that make sense if you enjoy the food and the place. No waiting area to wait in for a table and with rain outside kids and stroller this wasn't the fun part at ..Waitress was attentive and polite.

Very tasty. Moroccan Salad , Artichoke spinach pizza, Thai pizza and Zvegetsble pizza . All were delicious and presented well.  Service was spot on and very attentive .  Haven't been to Calif Pizza Kitchen in years. I'm glad they've kept with the times and have improved.  I don't think I'll wIt so long to return.
Great service from Melissa. Avocado egg rolls were excellent. Kids' favorite was pepperoni pizza.

I usually go to CPK in Coral Gables. I haven't had everything, but in the 5 to 7 times I've been there every experience was Good!  So I walked into this location expecting the same. But the quality and freshness I've come to expect were completely absent. I had the corn guacamole and the fish tacos. This is not the usual guacamole, which was fine, but it barely had any taste, the little bit of avocado in it was in little chunks, and had that off green color that says it wasn't even close to fresh. It also had none of the flavors of guacamole--no onions and no lime flavor. The fish in the fish taco although fried, was flavorless, dry, and that off color that says not fresh fish!  If this was the first CPK I visited I would never go back.  I saw the place was a bit empty, but I tried it because of my past experiences! But sorry to say this is a no!

I ordered delivery thru doorstep. Surprised the food was great even though it wasn't "fresh". The jambalaya was really tasty and the bbq chicken pizza was also delicious. Only issue was that it was kinda expensive ordering thru doorstep but I guess that is not the fault of the restaurant. Next time I will just pick up because i spent $10 extra just for delivery

Super good Pizza, nice atmosphere, very friendly staff. I came here to for a small bite, perhaps something quick like an app or something just a place to sit and hang for a few, California Pizza Kitchen was the perfect spot. I ordered a small veggie Pizza with came with loads for drag grilled veggies and about 6 small slices, good enough for 2-3 people. The pizza was delicious made with high quality ingredients. We were lucky to grab a seat outside it was a nice warm night out and perfect for outdoor dining. The waiter was super cool and attentive. I will return again soon, perhaps a bit hungrier to order some of their other Pizzas.  5 Pizza rating
The BBQ chicken and Bacon pizza is beyond amazing! I will be coming back soon!! The crust was perfect! I love the ambiance and the communal sink is genius!! I need one closer to home!!!!!

Great for kids, fast seating and consistent food. Top orders here are chipotle chicken, avocado club egg roll and the salads are very good.  For the kids the "do it yourself pizza" is always a hit.  If it's very busy I recommend string by the oven and watch the chefs do their thing. Also the bar has great service and usually available seating. On the subject of seating the outside seating has great ambiance.

So I have been to this location more than once, but I had BY FAR the best experience this last go around sitting at the bar with Ryan as our bartender.   We stopped by at around 7:30pmish on a Friday night, and we ended up very happy to be sitting at the bar with Ryan.  He was extremely attentive and offered each of us a great drink suggestion based on what we told him we were in the mood for.  The drinks were fabulous! I highly recommend the white sangria- it's like getting two drinks for one with how big it is! The pizzas we ordered as appetizers hit the spot. The ladies and I are all in accord that we will come again sometime again for appetizers and drinks at the bar! :)

Hubs and i normally go to the Boca location, but today we tried the sunrise/ sawgrass one. As usual, the Gorgonzola pear pizza was delicious!! One of our favs!! We sat at the bar and had phenomenal service by Kristen!

The service is good, however their drinks are mediocre we were given glasses filled with ice no flavor whatsoever,  therefore we returned them,  regardless we were charged,  full price the manager did finally removed them from the bill.  I give all the stars to our waitress she was great!

Great service, very good food. Was there for lunch with a friend.  We had the personal pizza with a salad.  The pizza is cooked quickly in their oven maybe 90 seconds or so.  Thin crust with fresh toppings.  My only comment is the salad could use more tomatoes.  The service is fast, and the staff teams up to make sure you get good service.  The prices are very reasonable.  I was raised in Brooklyn so I'm fussy about pizza.  This pizza passes with me.  It's a chain operation but the food doesn't have that chain blandness.   Let me say again the service was fast and polite.  My friend had the espresso and said it was very good.  I'll take his word because he's a coffee lover.

I've heard about California Pizza Kitchens foreverrrr and honestly expected them to be comparable to fancy Pizza Huts so I never gave them a try... I found out last night that I was wrong.  I'm not going to say that they are better than mom & pop's pizza parlors, but I did enjoy my food.  Ordered the Caribbean sunset sangria in a carafe, which was absolutely delicious. Our glasses came filled with fresh mango, blueberries, and apples, which were nice to eat as a sort of dessert after the meal.  As for the pizzas, we ordered The Works on flatbread and the original White Pizza. The toppings portion of the white pizza was pretty good, the crust was phenomenal! Wow! The works was soooo yummy, they used good quality pepperoni and sausages which made all the difference. It was delicious on the flat bread, but next time I'd like to try it on the original bread.  The service at this location was great. They accidentally brought us a mushroom pizza instead of the white pizza and when I sent it back, the deliverer not only apologized but he sent the manager over to do so as well. Great customer service. And Mel, our waitress, was very sweet.  ONLY DOWNSIDE: In my honest opinion, everything was a bit overpriced.  Still good though

The "white pizza" I ordered tastes terrible, i had to return it couldn't even eat a slice. Then I ordered the Thai salad and i didn't like it either, had some weird taste to eat....it went to waste because I didn't want to send my food back again. Only thing I liked was their bread that they serve everyone and the spinach dip. I do not recommend this place and don't plan to go back. Definitely not a good place for picky eaters.

The Good: - we walked up to the host and asked to see the menu. He was very friendly and explained some of the options. His personality was one of the reasons we decided this restaurant vs the conveyor belt sushi inside the mall - the same positive host allowed us to pick our spot in the restaurant so we chose one near the windows - the menu had a lot of variety and some items I had never seen including Kung pao spaghetti and Korean BBQ pizza where every dollar of the sale goes to charity  - our server, Nikki, was also really friendly and awesome. She definitely helped with the 4 star rating. She refilled our drinks (mango lemonade and peach iced tea - both delicious!!) without us saying anything. That's a mark of great service.  - the food came in a timely manner and before the food there was bread with an olive oil dip - we ordered the butter cake for dessert and toon it back to the hotel with us. Sooo yummy! It's worth trying it out with the whipped cream which Nikki out in a little container for us so that it wouldn't melt from the heat of the cake. The cake is slightly sweet but not overwhelming.  - there is no charge to make the crust whole wheat - there is no additional charge to have two different halves on the pizzas - the pricing is pretty reasonable. $40 for two drinks, a shared 6 slice pizza and a cake with ice cream The Not So Good: - The pizza was just ok. We had half spicy chicken chipotle and half sausage/pepperoni with whole wheat crust. There wasn't too much chicken and it was buried in the corn and pepper topping. The pizza came with a cilantro crema which was fantastic. The sausage/meatball half really lacked sausage. On one of the three slices there was only one measly meatball which was unfortunate because the toppings were very good. The crust was slightly burnt as well.  - On the menu there is an additional $2ish extra charge for ice cream. Nikki did not inquire as to whether we wanted it or not so we were a little surprised when we received the bill and it was there but since she was so nice we decided to just go with it.  - When we got back to the hotel with the dessert we noticed that they didn't provide us with spoons to eat it with which was surprising because Nikki knew we were staying in a hotel. Thankfully we had a package of plastic spoons from before so we were able to eat the butter cake.  Summary: We will definitely go back to the restaurant because of the uniqueness of the menu and our overall experience.

I came here on a casual date with my girlfriend, and ordered the Bolognese spaghetti with sautéed mushrooms, and let me tell you, not one Italian place can even come close to the rich flavor and perfectly made noodles. To add to that, every time I come not only is it a great atmosphere but the staff is always friendly, especially  Tyna, who sold us on the Butter Cake dessert which is absolutely amazing and definitely worth a try. Great establishment all around, 5 stars ((:

We had a very nice late dinner after spending the afternoon doing after Christmas shopping. The service was great. Our waitress was very attentive. We had people in out party that had a gluten sensitivity. Management was accommodating and allowed us to have a gluten free pizza crust as our bread for an up charge. It was delicious! So I would recommend that you make that an options for those with gluten sensitivities.  This was my first visit to this CPK and I will definitely come back again for another visit.

My boyfriend and I decided to try something new being that we always head for Cheesecake Factory which is right across from this location. BAD IDEA. Not only did the pizza look like it was topping deprived, my meal came out first because our snobby waitress brought the wrong meal for my boyfriend. After waiting 15 min for his meal we enjoyed our salad and pizza which cost us 50 bucks. We would never make the decision to come back. We are just going to have the same meal with better quality somewhere else. And also for a more meaningful price. This location gets two stars in my book, only because of the amazing butter cake dessert (which by the way costs 10$).

I love this CPK. They still have the carnitas tacos here some locations (like Boca) have switched their menu to steaks and such, trying to be upscale. Not this one. Good service and is usually pretty quick. Limited beers on tap but a decent selection of bottled beer.

The restaurant was nice, modern, and clean. I really enjoyed the variety of the menu and decided to try the jambalaya pasta.. Glad I did - very good! The service was okay. We waited at the entrance for a host for about 10/15 minutes. Once we were seated, waited another 10 minutes to be greeted by our server. I bring this up because the restaurant was not busy (Sunday afternoon). Overall it was a nice twist on the traditional pizzeria and it's definitely worth a try.

The decor is great, very modern & welcoming.  Great place to hang out or meet for business. However the service is HORRIBLE.  Could possibly be the one time I went but it was unacceptable we were kept waiting over 5 minutes to sit while half the restaurant was empty, later the lady at the door points to a table "this is your table".  Waiter takes our order. 2 pizza, one water & one cocktail(which he recommend as the best cocktail in the house). Minutes later we get 2 pizza, one water. I hint at my drink to see if he would recall, but he brings me water. At this point I wasn't even in the mood for a drink anymore. We get the bill, 2 pizza, one water & one cocktail. When I point it out he apologizes & removes the cocktail. The California pizza was great, my water on the rocks cocktail was ok :) Service needs to improve. I will give them one more try & will update my review.

Opted for CPK as opposed to the noisy packed restaurant across the way. The décor in this CPK is not like the one located in Miami. It has a more rustic feel which I can dig! It had been years since I stepped in a California Pizza Kitchen... Espresso - good to know they offer this, I needed a pick me up after a long day in the sun!  White Corn Guacamole - I would have preferred more Guacamole as opposed to a plate filled with chips... but it was good and loved that you could actually taste the white corn!  White Pizza - Very good white pizza just wish there was more spinach!!  Overall glad we chose CPK as we could actually have a conversation and I was pleased to learn of all the options that they actually offer on the menu, definitely more than just a pizza place!

Where do I begin?? I've eaten at California kitchen before and never have I seen such unprofessionalism.. The hostess are sweet young girls however their seating system is ridiculous. I'm not sure why management wouldn't approve a pager system or text guest when their table is ready. The hostess are literally SHOUTING customers names while everyone was trying to dine.  The bathrooms were disgusting, even after bringing it to the attention of the staff it fell upon deaf ears... Trash receptacles overflowing and the bathroom reeked of urine.. We did however enjoy the service at the bar. BRETT is the tape that's holding this place together.. This Californian kitchen is located in one of the busiest malls with that being said it should have the staff to maintain it and run this restaurant appropriately! Furthermore the staff is young and lack the experience and knowledge required to wait on tables accordingly!

I love the food at CPK But on more then one occasion the service at the sawgrass location was not the best. Waitress never came by for refills on our drinks. Had a bad attitude and very slow service.  Food is always great though.
Delicious pizza, great service, and great design inside the restaurant. Perfect escape from the craziness of the mall environment or after a long day shopping.

Inconsistent. My daughter enjoyed her salad entree. The pea soup had a lovely creamy texture and nice deep pea flavor but could have been served at a warmer temperature. The chicken Milanese was too thick. It needed to be pounded thin and served crispy. Today it wAs just so-so. The server was very friendly and attentive. The ambiance was inviting.

Nice pizza that i have ever tried beside the pizzas shops like Domino, pizza hurtz, papa john....this restaurant has a lot of different sizes and slices that you can ordered. I like their pepperoni crunchy pizza. It was very thin and not so grease like a thick regular ones. Also, they have a lot of nice and delicious salads which are very healthy and fresh. Waitresses are so friendly and welcome you all the time you are coming from the front door. High recommended
Food was great. Salads were awesome. Service was horrible.  We got our appetizers before our drinks...ice tea water and Pellegrino...

Excellent Service, Delicious food, and really quick! My friend and I came in here for a quick bite to eat before the movies, the GM instantly told us he will expedite our order, and in 15min, we had gourmet lettuce wraps and ginseng chicken cooked to perfection.

Had a lot of food from the menu and have not been disappointed yet. love this place. the avocado spring rolls are great the dessert was great no complaints on my end. Even the waitresses I had were very nice and friendly.

Some of the best service I've had at a CPK. Our server was Katrina and she was very attentive. The food was great, standard cpk food. For dessert, we had the butter cake a la mode... It was phenomenal! We devoured it in less than a minute.

Today my fiancé and I went in for lunch and were AMAZED at the professionalism of the staff, the quality of the ingredients, and the promptness of the service. We have been to many CPKs in the area but this one is the best! Bread was delivered to our table fresh from the oven. Our server Catherine was knowledgable on both the food and drink menu, and made two wonderful suggestions. Our food came out freaky fast and was deliciously crisp and flavorful. I had the jerk chicken and spicy carnitas pizza, while my fiancé enjoyed the Kung Pao Spaghetti. The manager even stopped by to see how we were liking out adage of sangria. Truly a 5 star experience! Kudos and we will be back again!

We had a bit of an issue at first. The food took like 45mins to come out and the pasta tasted like it had been sitting for a while. But the manager came over talked to us explained the situation. He was extremely nice and seemed to genuinely care. He turned what was a horrible dining experience into a very pleasant one. We really appreciated it. I think his name was Danny or denny. The food ended up being very good it was just a shame it took so long. I wish the waitress would have just told us, we would have been understanding....but she did not. Regardless the manager fixed the situation. I would come back again, and recommend to others.
The pizzas here are amazing! Def worth going to if you want a variety of different kinds of yummy pizzas.
Excellent and friendly service. Large variety of sandwiches and pizza. Food very good.

I've seen their pizza's in the grocery store and figured I'd finally give 'em a shot.  I ordered some to-go food and it was great.  The to-go was quick, they gave me everything correctly, and even threw in some bread.  I'd give it 5 stars, but it was a little pricey... especially when there are so many other non-chain, authentic pizzerias nearby.

Wow this place is amazing!!!   Just discovered that we have a CPK across the street from where I live 2 weeks ago and I've been there twice already!!  I went to the one in ft LAUDERDALE on federal a few years ago and I didn't like it.  But this CPK at this location is fabulous!!!!  The ambience is beautiful and great outside seating for these glorious weather days we are having!!  You can sit and people watch the mall goers, with great food, great drinks, great ambience and great service!!!!   I've ordered the peach salad, flat bread, dumplings & pizza, all were outstanding good quality foods!!  The sangrias are also great with fresh fruit in them!!!  The only thing wrong with this location is the parking, almost impossible to find a spot so we always have to valet park so add another $8 before the tip for parking ugh....but otherwise I would highly recommend this restaurant!!  I only wish it wasn't in the sawgrass mall to ease the hassle of parking...

My day was a complete nightmare until I arrived in the doors at this California Pizza Kitchen. The service and staff hit it out of the ball park! Literally no time to wait they will sit you wherever u want ( as long as it isn't already occupied) no matter how big or small your party is and without any of that hidden resentment u get at other restaurants. The atmosphere is very classy and stands out, the staff is super nice and very complimentary they really take care of you. You just feel more comfortable being inside or outside the confines of this restaurant. The food is divine and always good! The drink selection is also impressive they serve house made sangrias and have local draft selections at a low price and the bartenders always make great selections for things to try and really seem to know what they are talking about. I've returned many times to this restaurant and will many times again they never let me down A+ all the way!

Last visit at this CPK was a bit sub par.  Had to place a to go order for someone at home.  Waitress never told us kitchen was closing or came back to check if we needed anything before the kitchen closed.  Waitress stated she would get the manager to see if maybe something could be done, maybe a to go salad instead.  I guess the manager didn't want to talk to us.  Only additional follow up was the bill.  A bit disappointed this time around.  I wasn't going to complain just wanted to know if I could order a cobb salad to go.
We hadn't been at a California Pizza Kitchen in a long time, our visit was great. The wait staff (Keith)!is outstanding, drinks and food were very good.

We were going to the movie theater and stopped here for dinner.  There was a crowd in the door and no-one was taking names, the hostess seamed disoriented and confused.  There were tables outside but they were not seating customers.  The manager or I assume the manager told us that he had one (1) waiter for the outside and he also worked inside so if you sat outside you were going to have to be patient and wait....  uhuh this is at 6:00 p,m. and I can only imagine what would happen at 8:00 p.m. when most ppl go out for food.. there seems to be an overwhelmed feeling from everyone in the place, as if a crowd was something they didn't know how to deal with.  To the food, we had the wedge salad and it was good and ordered the maragurita pizza on hand tossed dough.  It was ok but nothing I'd come back for, neither the experience or the food.

Can't believe I haven't written a review for this place yet, they're AMAZING!!! Food is great, the place is visually pleasing, but what I love the most is the superb service! Every time I go, the staff is always super friendly and courteous. My waiter from last time was Angel-- totally made the experience of dining in ten times better! We got into great conversations and he also was on top of it getting us everything we wanted. I'm already a regular here and will be coming back often :)

I came here a month ago.   Ordered the Mushroom Pepperoni Sausage and  did not like the pizza.   I was expecting huge chunks of pepperoni and sausage.  Hey, I lika ma meat!!!    I was surprised because I once ordered the gluten free pizza online and drove there, parked in their designated pickup spot, called them and they brought my order out.    I can't remember which one I ordered but I remember thinking that it was good pizza.

I really like pizza and California Pizza Kitchen serves up a good pie. My girlfriend and I went here for lunch and were sat pretty quick. The place wasn't too crowded at 1pm. We were seated and a server came up to us rather quickly and took our drink order. About a minute later, another server came up and introduced herself. There seemed to be some confusion about who should have been handling our table. The first server came back and took our order and we never saw him again. Someone else delivered the food. He never came back to check on us and we had to flag him down to get a refill on my girlfriends drink. He had tables he was serving on the other side of the restaurant so he disappeared a lot. We waited longer than we should have for our check and it was a manager who ended up running it for us. While they were all friendly, this location seemed to be understaffed and not run properly.  The food we ordered was decent. We both ordered lunch size pizza with a side salad. The pizza was great but the salad was only ordinary. Sadly we just left frustrated with the service.

I have always been a huge fan of CPK. They usually have excellent service and delicious food. This was the first and probably last time I'll ever come to this particular CPK. My boyfriend and I walked in on a Thursday night around 6:30 or 7pm. There was no hostess/host at the stand. After a little bit of time, the bartender (I think) came by to seat us. There was no apology for our wait and barely any greeting. We were seated and began to look at the menu. Our waitress took a long time to swing by to say hello or get our drinks. We were ready to order once she finally came by to get our drinks, but weren't even given the opportunity. Once again, no apology on our long wait to be acknowledged. She took our drink orders and basically ran off to fetch them instead of see if we had any questions on the menu or if we were ready to order. We ordered when she came back and the food was mediocre. We had very little sauce on our pizzas (a barbecue chicken pizza and Thai chicken pizza) and were told that we can't get extra sauce after the pizza has been made. The icing on the cake was when we were done with our meal, we wanted dessert. The waitress came back to ask if we wanted any dessert and when we said yes, I thought she went to get a menu for us but instead we were presented with a check. NO THANKS. I have never experienced such terrible service from a well-known restaurant, and bad food to top it off. I'm not sure if service is always that bad, or if it was just a classic case of "they look like a super young couple and they won't tip well anyway so I'll barely take care of them". I'll take my business elsewhere for that price.

So I love cpk but this place is not like any other cpk. The manager EDDIE always pays attention to every detail, he is not only a professional worker but an unbelievably nice person, no matter if it's 10 pm and he's tired he will always greet you with smile! I'm so thankful I found this location I drive here especially for this crew. Great people make great food!

I love CPK. Went there today for lunch after seeing Star Wars. Our server was Danielle, very pleasant, quick, not overly attentive but attentive enough. Ordered the thai pizza and a moroccan spiced salad to share with my lunch date. Danielle brought us bread right out of the oven to start. Nice and hot, with a good chew to it. The salad was very good, great flavors and a good amount. The pizza was fantastic, nice chewy crust, hot, toppings proportioned well. In and out in about 30 minutes. Stop on by!

We went there tonight after the game at the BB&T Center. The restaurant itself is nice and big, trendy and as long very clean. There wasn't a wait and we were seated immediately. Our waiter was nice and helped us pick out food to order. We both had drinks, my dad had a beer and I had a margarita. I got the Strawberry Basil Margarita and it was pretty good. We got bread and dipping oil while we waited for our food. The waiting time was short and our food came nice and hot. We both got pasta dishes and both were good, similar to something you would get at Olive Garden. Overall we were satisfied with our meal.
Nice little spot for a quick bite. Sit at the bar-----bartender is awesome! Drinks are good and speedy service.

*facepalm* Never, seriously, never have I been to a chain restaurant and been blatantly ignored. Our server came took out orders, didn't introduce herself or chat us up, okay, fine I don't really need that. I should've asked for three cups of water because once she took our order it's like she vanished in thin air...I kept seeing her walking around, she came from the back a few times chewing, okay maybe it was a long day and she needed a boost, but literally nothing. At one point a manager came over to refill my water and offer us parmesan cheese, which I watched every other table receive with their meal. But maybe he didn't realize the horrid service we were receiving. Okay, so Sunrise is a pretty mixed community, the mall brings large crowds of people, mostly foreigners. And...I....really ...hate...to...play...the...race...card...because I want to believe in everyone's positive intentions....BUT... I watched her attend to others (non brown) as a server should.  P.S. my pizza was burnt...crumbled into pieces when I took a bite, couldn't cut with a knife. I had to get out of there, it was awful and I had to go elsewhere to get dessert, because who knows how long I would've waited for a menu.
I love CPK :) Wish there was one closer to Coconut Creek. Thai chicken pizza is my go-to but they have added some really great new menu items. Definitely order the buffalo cauliflower!

Decided to go to this restaurant after the hockey game, checked the closing time first and saw that they close on Friday's at 11:30, went out of our way to eat there, got there at 10:50 and the doors were closed. You should change your ours of operations or stick to what's written

This California pizza kitchen is always our go to place when we go to Sawgrass. The food is always good and always tastes fresh. The management at a this location really runs a tight ship and we have always had prompt and courteous service. In this day and age it's refreshing to go to a well run restaurant with good food and good service.

I've been to plenty to CPKs in my lifetime and this is by far the best one. The service is wonderful and it's very fast. I tend to dine with my girlfriend and she is quite a picky eater they recommended something that we both could enjoy and they accommodated her food to her liking which was very nice of them. They have really great speciality drinks and one who doesn't enjoy pizza normally, I actually really love the various types they serve here. I recommend the Tostada thin crust with Cholula it's the absolute best. The little rolls for appetizer are great for sharing with a group of people. They have a nice wine list and a good selection of beer. (I love Newcastle)  I do recommend coming here for a chill and nice place to hang with friends and not spend your entire paycheck.

Didn't realize how many times I have been here. Long due to write a review for this restaurant. Side note: I'm picky about pizza and I actually don't usually like California Pizza Kitchen. All the other locations are just blah.  Now that we have set that straight, let me tell you about this CPK location.  It's set up very nicely with fire place tables outside, nice bar area with TVs and long tables, good regular setting area and a very clean and open kitchen.   They opened a year ago and they just have been improving with each visit I have been there. The managers are nice and care about their customers. The servers are efficient and professional.  The pizza is yummy and not very oily.  My favorite is the pear and Gorgonzola one.  It's very unique and the taste blends very nicely.  Sam loves their California Veggie.  I like the fact they have some healthy choices even though it's a chain restaurant.   Their chocolate soufflé, tiramisu, and butter cake are great choices for your sweet tooth cravings.   Go check this location out, it's good!  Last note: download the cpk app and get some free appetizers and other rewards for dining.

It's very hard for me to be impressed with vegetarian food that's not home made. But CPK was so impressive that we would definitely go here again.  1. Service was good 2. Appetiser was fantastic  3. Pesto pasta was amazing  4. Pizza was good  5. Dessert was wonderfull  If you are vegetarian or want to try something new you just try the buffalo cauliflower and the Mediterranean spring roll and you must must just try the pesto pasta.

would love to rate five stars and would if it wasn't in this mall.  malls and I are just not feeling connected lately.  I think im not alone.  in any case, this is the closest location to me.  ordered takeout.  Hawaiian pizza and two thai chicken crunch salads.  guy at front gave us bread and pesto dipping sauce too.  everything really good. just pricey for takeout in my mind. décor clean and modern as this location is fairly new.
Great atmosphere and fast service. The pizza came out so amazing! I love the jamaican jerk pizza! Its so good! I cant wait to go back and try a new pizza again!

I got a catering order for 20 people today and it was great. The order was on time, well packed, and the portions were generous. Everything we needed was included. I would recommend using CPK if you need a delicious catered lunch. The staff was on point in getting every thing together.

This location was great. My husband and I stopped here for lunch after some shopping and we were attended to right away. The service was great I believe our servers name is Cindy. She gave us suggestions on what to eat and she made sure our cups were full. The food was great! I had the lunch special which was a soup and half sandwich, it was the perfect amount of food. Everything was great I recommend this location.

New to the Sawgrass Mills mall. California Pizza Kitchen is a great addition to the facility. Everyone loves pizza! The menu includes other items that I have not tried. The tiramisu is excellent. I have 2 kids and their kids menu is extremely affordable. Lots of choices. Free refills on all kids drinks, including chocolate milk and apple juice. The kids desserts are $1 and include a choice of a brownie or Sundae. Good service. Great food. Check them out!

I love the wild mushroom pizza, the pear something-something and redvelvet for dessert. If you like starters, the white corn guacamole is awesome. The mac and cheese we didnt like. If you like to keep on the healthy side, the whole wheat dough i great, and ask for pizzas that have many leafy greens on top.. All awesome!

The food is great! Their salmon was absolutely amazing it had a great taste and texture. The staff was friendly and came often to see if everything was alright. Lovely staff, amazing food, nice ambiance.
Love the lettuce wraps. Spicy pizza thin crust great. Red velvet cake for my birthday was sweet and delicious. Recommend sharing

i was here last saturday august 2. place was pretty packed (tax free weekend) food is very good! service was excellent!  however, the hostess ignored me and my little kid and decided to entertain a party of 4 that got there after me. i was literally standing in front of the hostess stand outside waiting to be acknowledged but when the party of 4 got there i was skipped and the hostess decided to talk to them first. thankfully the party behind me had the courtesy to tell the hostess that i was there first. i understand if there were no tables ready for 2 guests but atleast acknowledge your guest as a courtesy and do not ignore them. i did not ask for the hostess name but she was a dark skinned lady with curly hair.  i am a regular at the coral gables location and they get extremely busy.  i feel that the hosting staff at that location has a more welcoming vibe.
Service was a little slow but the restaurant was very busy. The thin crust pizzas were very good as were salads.

Wow - this pizza was not good. Let me first talk about the positive things: - they do offer whole wheat/grain crust, which is a big plus; - they do have healthy menu options like split pea and quinoa on their menu; - their customer service was great, maybe even excessively nice; - their salted caramel pudding was good, but not the greatest. Negative:  - pizza toppings either too little or too much, with too many sauces - pizza just did not taste good. My fiance could not not finish his pizza and did not even want to box it. They provided us with free dessert, which was nice on their part.  We will not be coming back .  We were really hoping for a good pizza joint but I guess California Pizza Kitchen is not the one.

Worst pizza I have ever been served.  A "white" pizza with so little cheese on it that most of it was just like a large, dry, crisp cracker.  I should have sent it back, but I was with coworkers, so I did not want to make a scene.

Service is a little slow but if you love fresh, fire oven baked style pizza (with out the burned crust) then you will love the pizza here. Love their drinks (frozen mango lemonade and sangria), atmosphere and over all the food is good. I always skip the dessert here and that is why I rated it 4 stars.

Friendly service and although is a chain, the food remains loyal to its roots from California where I used to eat at quite often while living there in the 90's. The chicken tequila fettucini remains as my all time favorite along with their legendary BBQ chicken pizza. The strawberry lime margarita (shaken) is amazing!!! I am not sure if they make it with fresh strawberries but it sure doesn't taste like syrup. Love CPK!

I know, its a chain but we really enjoyed a wonderful lunch while visiting the area. First the bad ...  The service was rather slow.  We waited almost 25 mins for our food after we ordered. The server was new and she overcharged us and it took 3 tries to have the check corrected! Other than that there were no issues so moving on to the good part...  The kids picked pizza and pasta from kids menu which was standard but they liked it. We ordered the guacamole and chips as a starter and it was fresh and flavorful.  For our main entrees we got the roasted veggie salad and the roasted veggie pizza on whole grain crust.  Hubby and I shared the two items and they were both tasty.  I love it when restaurants don't skimp over ingredients in a salad.  You know, some places its 70% lettuce and only 30% main components. This one didn't, there was a good quantity of roasted veggies and avocado on the salad along with the lettuce.  It was tossed well in the dressing.  Just perfect.   The pizza was excellent and the best part is my kids asked to try a slice because it looked so appetizing.  And then they asked for seconds!

Not bad at all. I met up here with a couple of friends and their adorable baby yesterday. Although it was lunch time on a Sunday there was no wait (although it was pretty busy by the time we left).  The server was friendly and attentive, and made sure the kiddo had her food quickly (good call, server lady!) My buddy and I shared the Wild Mushroom Pizza with Truffle Oil and Chicken Club Sandwich. The pizza was really good and had a good ratio of cheese and toppings. The only thing that was odd was the fact they serve the truffle oil on the side... in a little dish. This made it a little awkward when trying to pour the oil evenly on the pizza, but I guess we were able to handle this daunting task :) Only gripe: I prefer my pizza to be crispy... the dough/pizza was cooked thoroughly, but a little more crispy would have been nice.  The club sandwich was tasty as well, but big chunks of lettuce made it a little messy (the lettuce kept falling out with every bite). Again, we managed. Overall... great service and tasty food. Would I go back? Probably not my first choice, but I wouldn't object :)

We would've had a good time if they hadn't messed up twice. The server was great but the kitchen messed up our pizza and put BACON in it which is a serious problem because we don't eat pork for religious reasons. Once we told them, they took it back and the manager offered dessert but we were done. The other pizza we got was good (can't remember which one). They also made our virgin pina colada wayyyyy too sweet. It was like pure pineapple juice. Had to send that back too. Womp womp womp.

I was really surprised and impressed! I had never eaten here before but I'm glad my friend insisted because it was great! Their Sangrias are amazing and you have to try their egg rolls! We will definitely be back!  The Manager was super nice too! She kept coming by to check on us.

Ordered chapotle chicken was A+ perfect. Shared it my husband.  Got it in thin crust. Service was good. I would come back again, great restaurant, perfect options. Ordered the hummus and was pretty good too.

Pizza was only Ok this time. But what I came here to 'complain' mainly was POOR service and hygiene! Went for late lunch on a monday, so was empty. Server was very slow. Didn't bring water refills and didn't come back to check on us, or to give the check. He was too busy talking to his co-workers. Servers look very inexperienced or lazy (?), bringing your HOT pizza without a glove, rubbing against his shirt... the other guy picking his nose... servers checking a girl out when she walks in because she has almost no clothes on... lol Maybe, only maybe I'll be back. I've had much better experiences at other locations.

The front attendant completely skipped us in line, which I fixed. Our party of 5 was placed at a table for 4. Not a good start. Food was good otherwise. Would only come back if there was nothing else available. First impressions are everything!

Wow. Boyfriend and i hated this place, first time went to Boca (separate occasions) and hated it since. We decided to give it one last try and was blown away. Pizza, service, beer. Wow blown away. Best pizza place i know in south Florida and what tops it is they have rogue brutal ipa. If you dont know what it is its a strong amazing beer served in 650ml. So thank you wolf gang puck for going out of business, thank you.
Food is very good. We go all the time.  I love the barely and pea  soup and the chicken and arugula dish.  Pizza is great too of course!

My wife & I come here often. It's one of our favorite restaurants. We often sit at the counter & can't believe what a great, hard working team. The pizza guys are machines. Eyron the Asst GM introduced himself & couldn't have been nicer! Great food! Great restaurant!
